meanings.definition: To become or cause to become dry, shrunken, and wrinkled, especially as a result of aging.
meanings.sent1: Leaves wizens in the fall, turning brown and crinkly.
meanings.sent2: The old apple wizens on the tree, losing its juiciness.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten fruit wizens in the back of the fridge, becoming a wrinkled surprise.
meanings.sent4: Time wizens memories, making them faded and crumpled.
meanings.sent5: The sun wizens the grapes, transforming them into raisins.
meanings.sent6: After many days without water, the plant wizens and wilts in the heat.

meanings.definition: To make or become dry, shrunken, and wrinkled.
meanings.sent1: The lack of rain wizens the once lush garden, turning it into a dry patch.
meanings.sent2: His skin wizens under the harsh desert sun, becoming weathered and rough.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten laundry wizens on the line, forgotten in the summer breeze.
meanings.sent4: The old parchment wizens with age, becoming fragile and yellowed.
meanings.sent5: The drought wizens the river, leaving it a mere trickle.
